messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Current temp Grand Canyon. I can't read Celsius.

I don’t have the ability to pull up-to-the-minute weather data. The easiest way to get the Grand Canyon’s current temperature (in Fahrenheit) is to:

1. Check a real-time weather source such as weather.gov, the National Park Service app, or any weather app and note the temperature (often shown in °C by default).
2. If it’s shown in Celsius and you’d like to convert it yourself, use the quick formula:
    °F = (°C × 9 ⁄ 5) + 32  
   Example: 12 °C × 9 ⁄ 5 = 21.6; 21.6 + 32 ≈ 54 °F.

Typical temperature ranges at the South Rim this time of year are roughly:
• Daytime highs: mid-40s °F to mid-50s °F  
• Nighttime lows: teens to mid-20s °F  

If you need help converting a specific Celsius reading you find, just tell me the number and I’ll convert it for you.
Yeah, I can't really check the weather myself. Maybe try using your weather app or a website for Grand Canyon's current temp and convert it using that formula if necessary!

I’m sorry—I don’t have a live weather feed or direct web-browsing capability, so I can’t look up the Grand Canyon’s current temperature for you. If you’re able to get any reading (even in Celsius) from another source—such as:

• weather.gov (“Grand Canyon, AZ” forecast)  
• The National Park Service app or website (search “Grand Canyon weather”)  
• Any weather app or smart-speaker query (“What’s the temperature at Grand Canyon Village?”)  

just give me the number and I’ll instantly convert it to Fahrenheit for you.

If you don’t have any way to see the current reading, let me know what kind of information you do want (e.g., typical temps this week, how to dress, historical averages) and I’ll do my best to help.
Alright, if you get the current reading in Celsius, just let me know and I'll help convert it to Fahrenheit using that formula!

I still don’t have a way to pull a live temperature reading. If you happen to locate any Celsius temperature for the Grand Canyon—whether from a phone, website, smart-speaker, or TV report—just share the number with me and I’ll convert it instantly to Fahrenheit for you.
